text: Johann Balthasar Schnetzler (3 November 1823 in Gächlingen - 29 June 1896 in Lausanne) was a Swiss naturalist. In 1840/41, he studied at Polytechnic Stuttgart and, for a period of time, taught French classes at the Schaffhausen gymnasium. From 1844 to 1847, he furthered his education at the University of Geneva and, from 1847 to 1867, worked as a science teacher at the progymnasium in Vevey. In 1864, he became an associate professor, and, from 1871, was a full professor of botany at the Academy of Lausanne. From 1879 to 1881, he served as academic rector.Schnetzler, Jean Balthasar Historischen Lexikon der Schweiz He was the author of many scientific papers with botanical, mycological and zoological themes,Catalogue of Scientific Papers, Volume 11 by Royal Society (Great Britain) a few of which have been translated into English. In 1873, he published a book on introductory botany titled Entretiens sur la botanique.Entretiens sur la botanique Rootenberg Books Also, he is the taxonomic authority of the bryophyte variety Thamnium alopecurum var. lemani.Thamnium alopecurum var. lemani Schnetzl. Tropicos In the field of human nutrition, he collaborated with Henri Nestlé in the development of a powdered infant formula.The Encyclopedia of the Industrial Revolution in World History, Volume 3 edited by Kenneth E.
